PipeOpBranch

Source: R/PipeOpBranch.R
mlr_pipeop_branch.Rd

This pipeop is used for multiplexing between different possible paths and should be used in conjunction with PipeOpUnbranch.

PipeOpBranch

Format

R6Class object inheriting from PipeOp.

Methods

  • PipeOpBranch$new(options, id = "branch")
    (numeric(1) | character, character(1)) -> self
    Constructor. If options is an integer number, it determines the number of output channels / options that are created, named output1...output<n>. The $selection parameter will then be a ParamInt. If options is a character, it determines the names of channels directly. The $selection parameter will then be a ParamFct.

Parameters

  • selection: (numeric(1) | character(1))
    Selection of branching path to take. Is a ParamInt if the options parameter during construction was a numeric(1), and ranges from 1 to options. Is a ParamFct if the options parameter was a character and its possible values are the options values.

Details

Creates a PipeOp with multiple output channels that can be used to create a Graph network with alternative paths. If options is an integer(1), it determines the number of out-paths and selection is an integer parameter choosing between these paths. If options is a character, then length(options) out channels are created, each named according to options.

To create a usable graph, the branching paths need to be brought together using PipeOpUnbranch.

Not to be confused with PipeOpCopy, the naming scheme is a bit unfortunate.

See also

Other PipeOps: PipeOpEnsemble, PipeOpTaskPreproc, PipeOp, mlr_pipeop_NULL, mlr_pipeop_chunk, mlr_pipeop_copy, mlr_pipeop_encode, mlr_pipeop_featureunion, mlr_pipeop_filter, mlr_pipeop_learner, mlr_pipeop_majorityvote, mlr_pipeop_modelavg, mlr_pipeop_nloptmajorityvote, mlr_pipeop_pca, mlr_pipeop_scale, mlr_pipeop_subsample, mlr_pipeop_unbranch, mlr_pipeop_undersample, mlr_pipeops

Other Path Branching: NO_OP, filter_noop, is_noop, mlr_pipeop_unbranch

Examples

pca = PipeOpPCA$new()
nop = PipeOpNULL$new()
choices = c("pca", "nothing")
PipeOpBranch$new(choices) %>>% gunion(list(pca, nop)) %>>% PipeOpUnbranch$new(choices)
#> Graph with 4 PipeOps:
#>        ID         State sccssors prdcssors
#>    branch <<UNTRAINED>> pca,null          
#>       pca <<UNTRAINED>> unbranch    branch
#>      null <<UNTRAINED>> unbranch    branch
#>  unbranch <<UNTRAINED>>           pca,null
